etymology.description: semantic: 米(米) (mǐ, "rice") + phonetic: 甦(蘇) (sū, "revive") = rice used in revival or resuscitation -> resuscitate
etymology.interpretation: The character 穌 (sū, "resuscitate") uses 米(米) (mǐ, "rice") to signify sustenance or life-giving quality, combined with 甦(蘇) (sū, "revive") to emphasize the meaning of bringing back to life.

examples.chinese: 医生施穌病人(醫生施穌病人)，挽救了生命(挽救了生命)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng shī sū bìngrén, wǎnjiùle shēngmìng.
examples.english: The doctor resuscitated the patient and saved a life.

examples.chinese: 急救人员穌醒昏迷者(急救人員穌醒昏迷者)，恢复了健康(恢復了健康)。
examples.pinyin: Jíjiù rényuán sū xǐng hūnmí zhě, huīfùle jiànkāng.
examples.english: The paramedics resuscitated the unconscious individual and restored health.

examples.chinese: 医生及时穌醒心跳骤停者(醫生及時穌醒心跳驟停者)，挽回了危局(挽回了危局)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng jíshí sū xǐng xīntiào zhòutíng zhě, wǎnhuíle wēijú.
examples.english: The doctor promptly resuscitated the patient whose heart had stopped, averting a critical situation.
